articles.headline: Factory Jobs Gain, but Wages Retreat
articles.snippet: General Electric is adding jobs at its appliance factories in Louisville — even bringing some work back from overseas — but the newcomers are earning less than longtime workers.
articles.abstract: General Electric is adding jobs at its appliance factories in Louisville — even bringing some work back from overseas — but the newcomers are earning less than longtime workers.
articles.lead_paragraph: LOUISVILLE, Ky. — Manufacturers are hiring again in America, softening a long slide in factory employment. But for a new generation of blue-collar workers, even those protected by unions, the price of employment is likely to be lower wages stretching to retirement.

articles.headline: At Sears, Excessive Confidence Has a Price
articles.snippet: In creating Sears Holdings, Edward Lampert used financial alchemy to produce gold from retail dross. But now he plans to cut costs, fire employees and sell real estate.
articles.abstract: In creating Sears Holdings, Edward Lampert used financial alchemy to produce gold from retail dross. But now he plans to cut costs, fire employees and sell real estate.
articles.lead_paragraph: Becoming very rich can show that you are a genius.

articles.headline: Space Plan From China Broadens Challenge to U.S.
articles.snippet: A five-year development timeline unveiled Thursday by the Chinese government could establish it as a major rival in space at a moment when the American program is in retreat.
articles.abstract: A five-year development timeline unveiled Thursday by the Chinese government could establish it as a major rival in space at a moment when the American program is in retreat.
articles.lead_paragraph: BEIJING — Broadening its challenge to the United States, the Chinese government on Thursday announced an ambitious five-year plan for space exploration that would move China closer to becoming a major rival at a time when the American program is in retreat.
articles.byline: By Edward Wong and Kenneth Chang

articles.headline: In G.O.P. Field, Broad View of Presidential Power Prevails
articles.snippet: Even as they advocate for limited government, many of the Republican candidates hold expansive views about the scope of the executive authority they would wield if elected.
articles.abstract: Even as they advocate for limited government, many of the Republican candidates hold expansive views about the scope of the executive authority they would wield if elected.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Even as they advocate for limited government, many of the Republican presidential candidates hold expansive views about the scope of the executive powers they would wield if elected — including the ability to authorize the targeted killing of United States citizens they deem threats and to launch military attacks without Congressional permission.

articles.headline: An Uproar on the Web Over $2 Fee by Verizon
articles.snippet: The Web lit up with howls of protest as word spread of a new Verizon Wireless fee that will apply to people who make one-time credit or debit card payments on the phone or online.
articles.abstract: The Web lit up with howls of protest as word spread of a new Verizon Wireless fee that will apply to people who make one-time credit or debit card payments on the phone or online.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Web lit up with howls of protest on Thursday as word of a planned new Verizon Wireless fee spread wildly — and somewhat inaccurately.
articles.byline: By Ron Lieber and Brian X. Chen

articles.headline: As Supply Dwindles, Organic Milk Gets Popular
articles.snippet: With the price of organic grain rising, cows are being fed less — and are producing less milk. Meanwhile, the demand for organic milk is growing.
articles.abstract: With the price of organic grain rising, cows are being fed less — and are producing less milk. Meanwhile, the demand for organic milk is growing.
articles.lead_paragraph: There is a shortage of organic milk across the country, and it has become so bad in areas like the Southeast that Publix stores from Florida to Tennessee have put up signs in dairy cases anticipating the shopper’s frustrated refrain: “Where’s my organic milk?”

articles.headline: Letter That Led to Downfall of Hewlett Chief Surfaces
articles.snippet: The June 2010 letter that led to Mark V. Hurd’s downfall as the head of Hewlett-Packard paints a portrait of an executive who sought to impress a contract employee with his connections and wealth.
articles.abstract: The June 2010 letter that led to Mark V. Hurd’s downfall as the head of Hewlett-Packard paints a portrait of an executive who sought to impress a contract employee with his connections and wealth.
articles.lead_paragraph: The June 2010 letter that led to Mark V. Hurd’s downfall as the head of Hewlett-Packard paints a portrait of an executive who pressed a contract employee for sex, touched her inappropriately and asked her to spend the night with him.

articles.headline: Finding the Cleanup Crew After a Messy Hack Attack
articles.snippet: After a prominent attack on Stratfor, a security group, specialists in computer breaches say companies that are under siege must act quickly to assess and contain the damage.
articles.abstract: After a prominent attack on Stratfor, a security group, specialists in computer breaches say companies that are under siege must act quickly to assess and contain the damage.
articles.lead_paragraph: In the film “Pulp Fiction,” Harvey Keitel plays the Wolf, a fast-talking and meticulous man who is called in to deal with the aftermath of an accidental shooting.

articles.headline: Voters Examining Candidates, Often to a Fault
articles.snippet: The traits and background of the Republican presidential hopefuls enter into the thinking of many voters in New Hampshire and Iowa.
articles.abstract: The traits and background of the Republican presidential hopefuls enter into the thinking of many voters in New Hampshire and Iowa.
articles.lead_paragraph: DES MOINES — Jonathan Gabhart, a 21-year-old college student from Spencer, Iowa, is leaning toward voting for Ron Paul because of the Texas lawmaker’s unpolished speaking style — a “high-pitched, squirrelly voice,” as he put it. “He seems like a real person because of his eccentricities.”
articles.byline: By Michael Barbaro and Ashley Parker

articles.headline: Tax Benefits From Options as Windfall for Businesses
articles.snippet: Companies that granted stock options after the 2008 stock market collapse are benefiting from those awards too — in the form of tax savings.
articles.abstract: Companies that granted stock options after the 2008 stock market collapse are benefiting from those awards too — in the form of tax savings.
articles.lead_paragraph: The stock market’s rebound from the financial crisis three years ago has created a potential windfall for hundreds of executives who were granted unusually large packages of stock options shortly after the market collapsed.

articles.headline: Today’s Cable Guy, Upgraded and Better-Dressed
articles.snippet: As cable companies race to evolve, their front-line workers try to keep up with new dress codes and backgrounds in engineering and computer science.
articles.abstract: As cable companies race to evolve, their front-line workers try to keep up with new dress codes and backgrounds in engineering and computer science.
articles.lead_paragraph: The cable guy is becoming sleeker and more sophisticated, just like the televisions and computers he installs.

articles.headline: Wall Street Ends Back Where It Started
articles.snippet: The S.&P. 500 was statistically unchanged for the year, while the Dow was up 5.5 percent. Major European and Asian indexes declined by double-digit percentages.
articles.abstract: The S.&P. 500 was statistically unchanged for the year, while the Dow was up 5.5 percent. Major European and Asian indexes declined by double-digit percentages.
articles.lead_paragraph: Like a roller coaster returning to the platform, the stock market in the United States ended the last day of trading in 2011 just about where it started the year. But what a wild ride it was in between.
